intro: Eremogone kumaonensis, commonly known as the Kumaon eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and smartweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
